intro: Knautia luteola, commonly known as the yellow knautia, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and serrated, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in flat-topped umbels, and it thrives in full sun to partial shade in well-drained soils. Knautia luteola is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
